definition: the seven apertures of the human head: 2 eyes, 2 ears, 2 nostrils, 1 mouth
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger

sentences.english: By the time we arrived an hour late she was fuming.
sentences.chinese: 我们晚到了一小时，她正气得七窍生烟。

sentences.english: Therefore, in its toxicity and the dead, is often ground bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 故中其毒而死者，常是七窍出血。

sentences.english: By the time we arrived an hour later she was fuming with rage.
sentences.chinese: 我们晚到了一个小时，她正气得七窍生烟。

sentences.english: After having to wait nearly an hour and a half, she was foaming.
sentences.chinese: 等了将近一个半小时之后，她气得七窍生烟。

sentences.english: Sir Walter promptly boxed his son's ears.
sentences.chinese: 老沃特闻言七窍生烟，立马甩了他儿子一个耳光。

sentences.english: He foamed with anger over the matter.
sentences.chinese: 这件事气得他七窍生烟。

sentences.english: Therefore, in its venom body of the deceased, is often Qiqiao bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 故中其毒而死者，常是七窍出血。

sentences.english: Is who said, each female, all some seven orifices exquisite heart.
sentences.chinese: 是谁说，每一个女子，都有一颗七窍玲珑心。

sentences.english: When she heard he would come again, she fumed with anger.
sentences.chinese: 一听说他又要来，她七窍生烟。

definition: nine orifices of the human body (eyes, nostrils, ears, mouth, urethra, anus)
bloody mouth (from devouring freshly killed prey)
spout/spray/belch/to well up/to puff out/to spurt out
three immortal souls and seven mortal forms in Daoism, contrasting the spiritual and carnal side of man
